user.biography:
🌍 Where feminism and environmentalism come together.
🌿 Check out our hemp underwear brand @magithelabel!
👩‍💻 Created by @nergizdebaere

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 17, 2021. May be an image of sky and text that says 'HUMANS ARE NOT SEPARATE FROM NATURE WE ARE PART OF IT WE ARE IT. So why do industrialised humans think of themselves as separate from nature? CHICKS CLIMATE FOR CLIMATE'.

node.text: When we exploit nature, we exploit ourselves. Humans aren’t aliens to Earth, we are part of it. We are nature and the universe experiencing itself. Our modern day capitalist system exists to make us forget that, but we *can* alter this system - it’s not too late! How will you connect with nature this weekend? 🌻

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 17, 2021. May be an image of sky and text that says 'HUMANS ARE NOT SEPARATE FROM NATURE WE ARE PART OF IT WE ARE IT. So why do industrialised humans think of themselves as separate from nature? CHICKS CLIMATE FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 17, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'CHRISTIANITY PHILOSOPHY, AND HUMAN OTHERWORDLINESS The separation of humanity from nature can be traced back to the rise of Christianity 2,000 years ago. The Old Testament taught readers that God made "man" in his own image and "let them have" dominion over the Earth. This laid the foundations for René Descartes, who IS considered the father of modern Western philosophy to suggest in his work that animals were "machines" that lacked souls. 2 2/5 CHICKS FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 17, 2021. May be an image of tree and text that says 'DIFFERENT, BUT NOT SEPARATE There's no doubt that humans are unique in our ability to cooperate and use our imaginations to alter our environments. Our consciousness is certainly special, and we can use it to make the Earth an even more special place. But we can't survive without microbes and bacteria that keep our gut and skin healthy. Without bees and other insects that pollinate the plants we eat. Without trees that produce the oxygen we need to breathe. 3/5 CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 17, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HAVE "MODERN" HUMANS GOT IT ALL WRONG? The modern Western (and capitalist) world has wreaked havoc on the environment because of this disconnection from nature. With the advent of TV and other entertainment technology and more humans living in cities than ever before, modern day humans have lost touch with the simple joys of being outdoors. Indigenous people have been living symbiotically with nature for generations. Indigenous belief systems think of humans as intrinsically part of nature, which is to be respected, and never exploited. 4/5 CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 17, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'LET'S CONNECT WITH NATURE! When you're eating, think of the many different organisms that played part in growing the food that made it onto your plate. Be mindful and pay attention to the many different sounds, smells and colours of nature, and think of the ways you're a part of it. Make a commitment to connect to nature, and encourage others to do so as well. We lead busy lives, but we can always make time to respect and observe what sustains us and keeps us alive! 5/5 CHICKS CLIMATE'.
Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021 tagging @earthrise.studio. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'earthrise The problem with sustainability. 1/10'.

node.text:
Should we leave behind ‘sustainability’ and work towards regeneration? Sustainability has become such a buzzword, almost an excuse for some brands to charge higher prices. But what are we really sustaining? Shouldn’t we focus on rebuilding what has been destroyed and lost to the exploitation of capitalism? 

 @earthrise.studio breaks it down 🌍➡️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021 tagging @earthrise.studio. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'earthrise The problem with sustainability. 1/10'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise The term 'sustainable' has become a buzzword, but what are we sustaining and who for?'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise sustainable /sอ steineb(e)l/ noun the ability to be maintained at a certain rate or level. 'the sustainability of economic growth" meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. "the pursuit of global environmental sustainability"'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise While the concept of sustainability is important, the word has been exploited by commercial interests. Sustainability in its current form doesn't challenge existing systems of power or priviledge. In fact, sustaining the current system will only drive it to collapse. Source:Daniel Daniel Chrisan Wahl. (2016) Designing Regenerative Cultures. Source:Williams. (2019) Earthbound Report. 4/10'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'For example: Imagine an agricultural field that is struggling to produce food because it has been drained of its nutrients. A sustainable approach might keep spraying it with synthetic fertiliser, since the goal is to continue its production, but what about actually addressing the underlying issue and regenerating the health of the soil itself? 5/10'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise regenerative /rT' /rr'dzen(e)retv/ noun Relating to something growing or being grown again. 'the regenerative power of nature' Relating to the improvement of system, especially by making it more active or successful. 'The cells participated in a regenerative process that restored the injured muscle' place or'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise This changes everything. Regenerative practises are an example of an approach that moves beyond sustainability to actively improve and repair conditions conducive to life. Regenerative cultures are developed by observing the natural function of iving systems and working in collaboration with nature rather than against it. To be regenerative requires a systemic shift in how we live our lives and the way we think about our role in nature. Source: Daniel Christian Wahl. (2016) Designing Regenerative 7/10'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of ‎text that says '‎earthrise Regenerative Systems Framework System Vitality Increases Regenerating System Regenerative Human participation and design as nature. Reconciliatory Reintegrating humanss parto nature. ۔ERqu More Energy Required Restorative Humans doing things to nature. Less .s Energy Required Sustainable N”utral point preventing any further damage. Green Relative improvements. Degenerating System System Vitality Decreases Adapted from Bill Reed (2007) Conventional Practice Complianceto avoid legal actions. 8/10‎'‎.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise "A regenerative human culture is healthy, resilient and adaptable; it cares for life in the awareness that this is the most effective way to creating a thriving future for all of humanity.' Daniel Christian Wahl'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise This isn't a new idea. Indigenous peoples are have been practicing regenerative culture for millennia. We must listen and learn from indigenous wisdom when it comes to restoration and regeneration. Source: Daniel Christian Wahl. (2016) Designing Regenerative Cultures. Source:Ju Watson (2019). Lo Lo-TEK Design by Radical Indigenism 10/10'.
Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021 tagging @aurorajames, and @aoc. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'WHY SHOULD WE TAX THE RICH? AX CHICKS CLIMAT FOR'.

node.text: Whatever you think of @aoc and the dress she wore to the extravagant Met Gala, it’s undeniable that she’s revived a very important conversation around taxing the rich, especially among non-activist circles. Here’s why we *should definitely* tax the rich more ✨

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021 tagging @aurorajames, and @aoc. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'WHY SHOULD WE TAX THE RICH? AX CHICKS CLIMAT FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WE SHOULD TAX THE RICH BECAUSE THE MINIMUM WAGE THE HAS STAYED AN HOUR SINCE 2009. $7.25in 2009 is worth $5.69 today, so the minimum wage has actually gone down. CL CLIMATE'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WE SHOULD TAX THE RICH BECAUSE YOU PAY LESS TAX FROM THE SALE OFA STOCK THAN IF YOU WORKED FOR THE SAME AMOUNT OF MONEY. The idea that rich people somehow work harder, and therefore deserve their riches more, is profoundly misguided. Investopedia.org "Capital Gains Tax" FOR CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE RICHEST 1% OF AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS PAY 30% OF THEIR INCOME IN TAXES. If we raised this by 10%, we could yield $3tn over the next 10 years, and still leave them with an average of $1.4m per year each. This could pay for making public college tuition free, making huge investments in infrastructure, and tripling_the the budget for the National Institutes of Health. Colleg Diploma The Guardian, "What could the US afford it raised billionaires' taxes? We do the math" FOR CHICKS CLIMATE'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 15, 2021.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'IN 2021, EARTH OVERSHOOT DAY FELL ON JULY 29TH. This is the date when humanity has exhausted nature's supply of natural resources that can be sustainably regenerated in a year. But Overshoot Day isn't the same everywhere. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

node.text:
We use the term “rich countries” to describe countries in the Global North. But it’s clear that these countries aren’t “rich” in anything but stolen material wealth. It’s been stolen from the Earth, from indigenous people, from the Global South, from future generations.

The only question now is: when will the debt be repaid, and by whom? That’s why activism exists, to make sure the responsible people are held accountable. How will you be an activist this coming week? ✊

Data via @earthovershootday 🌍

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'IN 2021, EARTH OVERSHOOT DAY FELL ON JULY 29TH. This is the date when humanity has exhausted nature's supply of natural resources that can be sustainably regenerated in a year. But Overshoot Day isn't the same everywhere. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WHICH COUNTRIES ARE IN HUGE EARTH DEBT? Qatar's Overshoot Day is Feb 9th. If everyone lived like the average person in Qatar, we would require 9 Earths. The USA and Canada's Overshoot Day is March 14th. Most European countries use up Earth's resources before the end of May. CHICKS CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'SOME COUNTRIES DON'T EVEN HAVE AN OVERSHOOT DAY. Countries whose Overshoot Days fall in November or later include: Indonesia Ecuador Nicaragua Egypt Guatemala Iraq Cuba Colombia These countries are contributing the least to climate change, but will bear the brunt of a climate crisis. THIS IS CALLED CLIMATE INJUSTICE. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 11, 2021 tagging @wwf_uk, and @harrietgardiner_art. May be an image of text that says 'Swim in the sea Explore somewhere new Let nature inspire your creativity Go for Water your plants Listen to the birds Plant wildflower seeds walk WAYS TO CONNECT WITH NATURE TO HELP YOUR MENTAL HEALTH Grow your Look out for wildlife own veg WILDFLOWER SEEDS Watch a nature doc @wwf_uk Forest bathing'.

node.text:
We in the industrialised and capitalist world have separated ourselves from nature for so long that we’ve forgotten all the benefits just being in it can bring us. 

From improving your mental health to increasing ecological empathy, connecting with nature is *literally* priceless. Will you give it a try this weekend? 🌴🌸🌍🌻

Graphic from @wwf_uk and illustrated by @harrietgardiner_art ✨

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 09, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says '3 WAYS To SAVE THE PLANET CHICKS CLIMATE FOR Don't lose hope There's still time to avoid the worst. A lot of people are working on it more than you might think. Talk about it The more we raise awareness and educate others, the more people we have in the movement for change. Vote Ultimately, governments have the power to make climate policies. Vote for the ones that care.'.

node.text:
If you only can do a few things, these are probably the most impactful and accessible ♥️🌍✨

P.S. there are infinite ways to help the planet and our environment and those experiencing climate injustice, do whatever is right for you! 🧸

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 07, 2021 tagging @jzcreativespace. May be an image of text that says 'Taking Care Of Yourself Is Productive'.

node.text: Rest is radical in a society where productivity determines our worth. Taking care of yourself in a world where consumerism = self care, is radical and is productive. Let’s remember that, and bask in this wonderful art by @jzcreativespace ❤️‍🔥

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 07, 2021 tagging @jzcreativespace. May be an image of text that says 'Taking Care Of Yourself Is Productive'.
Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 07, 2021 tagging @jzcreativespace. May be an image of flower and text that says 'Be Kind The Planet'.
Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 07, 2021 tagging @jzcreativespace.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE "MODERN" HUMAN WORLD NEEDS TO RELEARN ECOLOGICAL EMPATHY IF THE HUMAN RACE IS TO SURVIVE. CHICKS CHICK FORTE FOR CLIMATE'.

node.text: Do you think modern society’s disconnection with nature is to blame for the climate crisis? Swipe to the last slide for tips on how to increase your ecological empathy ✨♥️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE "MODERN" HUMAN WORLD NEEDS TO RELEARN ECOLOGICAL EMPATHY IF THE HUMAN RACE IS TO SURVIVE. CHICKS CHICK FORTE FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'ECOLOGICAL EMPATHY IS ABOUT HAVING A CONNECTION WITH NATURE AND FEELING CONCERN FOR NON-HUMAN ENTITIES. Indigenous people, who make up 5% of the world population, have been living in a symbiotic way with Earth for millennia. Ecological empathy is part of indigenous identity. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'AS SOCIETIES HAVE MODERNISED. HUMAN CONNECTION WITH NATURE HAS DEPLETED. This can be seen as the root of climate change, because industrialised humans have associated nature (plants, trees, natural gas) with use that can be extracted, and have abandoned a sense of oneness with nature. CHICKS FOR FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'EVEN THOUGH INDIGENOUS PEOPLE HAVE BEEN LIVING SYMBIOTICALLY WITH THE EARTH FOR GENERATIONS, THEY ARE ONEOFTHE GROUPS SUFFERING THE MOST AS A RESULT CLIMATE CHANGE. Meaningful and mindful dialogue between climate bodies and indigenous groups is going to be vital for the future of the planet. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HOW TO INCREASE ECOLOGICAL EMPATHY: •When in a green space, acknowledge that you're an inextricable part of the ecosystem. Affirm this to yourself. Pay attention to how you feel when you're in nature. Studies show just looking at greenery can reduce stress. Plant a garden just because. Not just for growing "useful" things such as fruits or veggies. •Learn about animal behaviour by watching nature documentaries. Think ofhow animals' experiences mirror our own. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'ABORTION IS A RIGHT. Reproductive rights are at stake in the US. And climate change may make things worse. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR MY BO“DY MY CHÓICE'.

node.text: It’s terrifying that the world has come to this - but it’s not surprising. And more importantly, it’s not too late to make a positive change. Let’s support the orgs doing good - check the last slide for some amazing ones ♥️✨

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 03, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'ABORTION IS A RIGHT. Reproductive rights are at stake in the US. And climate change may make things worse. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR MY BO“DY MY CHÓICE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 03, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE US SUPREME COURT HAVE REFUSED TO BLOCK AN ABORTION BAN OVER 6 WEEKS IN TEXAS. The law also permits private citizens to enforce the ban and collect $10,000 if they win a case against someone helping others secure an abortion. CHICKS CHI CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 03, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'CLIMATE CHANGE MAY WORSEN ACCESS TO ABORTION AND OTHER REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH CARE. Whenever crises strikes in society, women's access to reproductive health like abortion and contraception is usually the first to be deprioritised. When countries are inevitably put under strain because of climate change, these rights will be at risk al over the world. The US has set a very dangerous precedent. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on September 03, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'REPRODUCTIVE RIGHTS AND CLIMATE ACTION SHOULD GO HAND IN HAND. When women are given the tools and control to decide when and whether to have children the wellbeing of themselves, their families and their communities increases as a result. Women and girls in the Global South are disproportionately affected by the climate crisis. Securing reproductive health means women are more likely to stay in school, have careers and become powerful agents of climate adaptation. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on September 03, 2021 tagging @womenforwomenuk, @janesdueprocess, @theafiyacenter, @teafund, @thebridgecollective, @careintuk, @ippf_global, and @fundtexaschoice. May be an image of text that says 'ORGANISATIONS TO FOLLOW AND DONATE TO: @fundtexaschoice @janesdueprocess @thebridgecollective @theafiyacenter @teafund @ippf_global @womenforwomenuk @careintuk CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021 tagging @earthrise.studio. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "This is my message to the western world- your civilisation is killing life on Earth." Nemonte Nenquimo NemonteNenquimo Nenquimo 1/7'.

node.text:
The Earth needs respecting, not saving. 

Slides by @earthrise.studio 🌎

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021 tagging @earthrise.studio. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "This is my message to the western world- your civilisation is killing life on Earth." Nemonte Nenquimo NemonteNenquimo Nenquimo 1/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise "As Indigenous peoples, we are fighting to protect what we love -our way of life, our rivers, the animals, our forests, life on Earth -and it's time that you listened to us." Source:Nemontenquimo.(2020).The Guardian. 2/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise "It took us thousands of years to get to know the Amazon rainforest. To understand her ways, her secrets, to learn how to survive and thrive with her." "When you say that you are urgently looking for climate solutions, yet continue to build a world economy based on extraction and pollution, we know you are lying because we are the closest to the land, and the first to hear her cries." Source:NemonteNnquimo.(2020) The Guardian. 3/7'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and text.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "In all these years of taking taking, taking from our lands, you have not had the courage, or the curiosity, or the respect to get to know us.' "To understand how we see, and think, and feel, and what we know about life on this Earth." .:qu.(2020). The Guardian. 5/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "This forest has taught us how to walk lightly, and because we have listened, learned and defended her, she has given us everything." "And you are taking all this away, not just from us, out from everyone on the planet, and from future generations." Soure.Nene.(2020)The Guardian. 6/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, outdoors and text that says 'earthrise "And so say to all of you: the Earth does not expect you to save her, she expects you to respect her. And we, as Indigenous_peoples expect the same. Soure.N2.a 7/7'.

node.text:
Left to its own devices, capitalism is destructive because it only prioritises economic growth. But we are finite human beings living on a finite planet. That’s why we need to correct for capitalism’s shortcomings by implementing policies that enact climate and social justice. 

If you’ve ever wondered about the link between capitalism and climate change, have a swipe through! As always, I encourage you to do your own deeper research as this is a very complicated topic. Think of this as dipping your toe into it 🛁 

Data about political donations is from Reuters 🔎

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'CAPITALISM ONLY PRIORITISES SHORT TERM PROFITS. There is no framework within capitalism to prioritise social or environmental interests only economic profits. Capitalism is incompatible with climate justice because it relies on exploitation and wielding power over both people and planet. Î T w -G-R-O CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'EXTRACTING AND BURNING FOSSIL FUELS FOR PROFIT HAS CAUSED CLIMATE CHANGE AS WE KNOW IT. Capitalism has improved many lives, but it has also destroyed many others'. Indigenous people in the US and Canada have been forcibly moved away from ancestral lands to make room for coal digging. Communities in the Pacific have been dealing with rising sea levels and poisonous oil spills. There isn't enough room on an Instagram slide to name the many other horrors inflicted by capitalism. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of money and text that says 'BECAUSE CAPITALISM DOESN'T FACTOR IN THE COST THE ENVIRONMENT, GOVERNMENTS HAVE TO FACTOR IT IN INSTEAD. But governments don't want to, because they're often heavily influenced by businesses that pollute the environment- either by lobbying or campaign donations. For example in the 2020 US Presidential election, U.S. oil and gas companies poured million political spending. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'GOVERNMENTS NEED TO: .TAX CARBON DECARBONISE THE ECONOMY SUBSIDISE ELECTRIC VEHICLES .PUNISH ECOCIDE IMPLEMENT A UNIVERSAL BASIC INCOME INTRODUCE A FOUR DAY WORKING WEEK CHICKS CLIMATE'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'AIR POLLUTION CAN AFFECT OUR MENTAL HEALTH CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

node.text:
There is no healthy level of air pollution. So why aren’t governments stepping up and protecting our lungs and our mental health? Who else is tired of the stalling? 😴

Source: The Guardian

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'AIR POLLUTION CAN AFFECT OUR MENTAL HEALTH CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'CUTTING AIR POLLUTION WON'T JUST BE GOOD FOR OUR LUNGS. A new study conducted in London shows that a small increase in exposure to nitrogen dioxide leads to a 32% increase in the risk of needing community- based treatment for mental health. Research also shows that increases in air pollution are linked to depression, anxiety and even decreases in intelligence. FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HOW CAN WE CUT AIR POLLUTION? governments can do Subsidise electric cars Tax carbon -Regulate pollution in factories and other industry Enforce pollution limits on gas cars What you can do .Try to bike or walk if you can, or use public transport Ask your local representative to enforce the above CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.
